definition:
A deployed configuration of one or more AIModels plus harness
   components (prompts, tools, memory, policies, interfaces) that acts
   as an effective Agent in some environment.
opposite_reasoning: While PassiveObject has the strongest opposition on agency dimensions, HumanAgent provides the most practical utility for AI safety monitoring. The AI↔Human distinction is critical for: (1) detecting AI impersonation of humans, (2) distinguishing AI-generated from human-generated content, (3) monitoring AI alignment with human values, and (4) identifying boundary violations where AI systems claim human-like agency inappropriately. This opposition captures both the artificial↔natural dimension and provides actionable steering for safety applications. HumanAgent is highly likely to exist in SUMO as a fundamental concept.
